meanings.definition: Having or causing an irritating sensation on the skin that makes you want to scratch.
meanings.sent1: The new sweater made my skin feel itchy, but the old one was even itchiest.
meanings.sent2: After rolling in the grass, my dog's fur felt the itchiest it had ever been.
meanings.sent3: The tag on my shirt seemed to have a competition to be the itchiest part of my outfit.
meanings.sent4: The sound of nails on a chalkboard is like the itchiest feeling for my ears.
meanings.sent5: The mosquito bite on my arm was so itchiest that I couldn't stop scratching it.

meanings.definition: Feeling a strong desire to scratch or rub a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The dry skin on my hands made them the itchiest they had ever been.
meanings.sent2: The poison ivy rash was so itchy that it made me feel like the itchiest person alive.
meanings.sent3: Watching someone scratch their head in confusion always gives me the itchiest urge to do the same.
meanings.sent4: The suspense in the movie was building up so much that it created the itchiest feeling in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation before opening a gift can be the itchiest feeling of excitement.

meanings.definition: Causing a strong desire to scratch or rub a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The detergent used on the clothes left a residue that made them the itchiest garments I had ever worn.
meanings.sent2: The wool scarf was so scratchy that it became the itchiest thing around my neck.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise party for my birthday was the itchiest secret to keep from me.
meanings.sent4: The suspenseful movie plot was the itchiest story that kept me on the edge of my seat.
meanings.sent5: The curiosity about the hidden treasure was the itchiest feeling that drove me to explore.
